intro: Nintendo Switch™ Exclusive! Experience the gritty realism and overwhelming graphics of open battlefield brutality! Head to the bloody battlefield of Normandy!
description:
On a vast, open field, the curtain rises on a brutal history! Experience historic battlefields brought to life with stunning realism and high-definition graphics! Set in World War II, this FPS game features photo-realistic visuals that will satisfy military enthusiasts. 
Team up with allies using different weapon classes: Assault, Support and Sniper! Master precision aiming and control to complete missions in multiple game modes. Progress through the battlefields on your way to victory.
D-Day and Operation Overlord, events that changed the course of history, unfold at your fingertips amidst the brutal, bullet-ridden war zone!
Immerse yourself in the ultimate FPS that combines intense combat with fierce strategy!

・Stunning graphics bring every grain of sand and wave to life on the beaches of Normandy.
・Join the Allied forces and carry out crucial missions on D-Day.
・Immersive 3D sound and physics engine deliver unparalleled realism.
・Photorealistic visuals capture the light and shadows of intense battlefields.
・Take cover behind burning tanks and destroyed fortifications for authentic combat.
・Choose from three strategic roles: Assault, Support, or Sniper.
・Master precise aiming and streamlined mechanics for realistic gunplay.
・Collaborate with your allies for exciting cooperative action.

Lead your comrades to victory in historic World War II battles!
Experience combat realism that will thrill military enthusiasts!
Enjoy precise gunplay that shines in tense moments!
Immerse yourself in stunning graphics and rich 3D effects that bring the world war to life.
Immerse yourself in the most realistic WWII FPS "World At War: Normandy" on Nintendo Switch™!

Synopsis
On 6 June 1944, Omaha Beach witnessed the fiercest battle of the Normandy landings. This 6-mile stretch of coastline, surrounded by 100-foot cliffs, housed formidable German defences. At 6.30am, soldiers from the US 1st and 29th Infantry Divisions began their assault. They encountered fierce German resistance. Many died before leaving their landing craft, while those who reached the beach faced relentless enemy fire.

The coastline was mined and covered with barbed wire, forcing troops to cross 200-300 yards of dangerous sand. German forces decimated landing craft and armoured vehicles with 88mm anti-tank guns and 75mm field guns. Snipers in hidden cliff positions targeted American officers and radio operators, while mortar teams unleashed a constant barrage.

Still, small groups of brave soldiers tried to break through the hail of bullets. Their courage offered hope against a potentially catastrophic failure. Although heavy casualties were expected, the Allies were able to secure a crucial foothold.
A historic battle that could be the turning point of the Second World War is about to begin.
